intro: Urelytrum gracilius, commonly known as the slender false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its reproductive structures include both stamens and pistils, and it relies on wind pollination. Urelytrum gracilius is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in its native habitat.
